meta.title: About Hana David | CELTA-Certified English Teacher
meta.description: Meet Hana David, CELTA-certified English teacher with a passion for personalized instruction. Native speaker specializing in one-on-one virtual lessons for adults.

story.title: My Story
paragraphs: I'm Hana David, and I bring a lifelong passion for languages and teaching to every lesson.

Born and raised in the United States, I developed a deep love for reading and languages from an early age. I studied history, foreign languages (French, Latin, Russian, and Spanish), and creative writing at the University of Memphis, while also volunteering to teach English to new immigrants.

After making aliyah to Israel in 2019, I pursued my dream of becoming a professional English teacher. In January 2025, I completed the prestigious CELTA certification (Certificate in English Language Teaching to Adults), where I was mentored by experienced EFL teachers and taught students from around the world.

During my training, I received high marks for creating authentic, engaging lesson materials, building strong connections with students, and designing relevant, practical lessons that make learning enjoyable.

Over the past five years, I have had the privilege of working with a diverse range of students—from high-tech professionals aiming to polish their presentation skills to university students preparing for rigorous academic exams. My approach blends Communicative Language Teaching with task-based learning, ensuring that every grammar point or vocabulary word is immediately applicable to real-life situations.

One of my proudest moments was helping a student who was terrified of public speaking deliver a keynote address in English at an international conference. Seeing his transformation from anxiety to confidence reaffirmed my belief that with the right support, anyone can master English.
Now, I'm dedicated to helping you achieve your English goals through personalized, one-on-one instruction tailored to your specific needs and learning style.

testimonial.quote: Hana's lessons are not just about grammar; they are about building the confidence to express yourself. She changed the way I view English.
testimonial.author: Michael R.

aliyah.title: Making Aliyah & Teaching in Israel
paragraphs: In 2019, I made aliyah to Israel—a journey that deepened my connection to both Hebrew and English. As an immigrant myself, I understand the challenges of adapting to a new culture and learning a new language. This personal experience has made me a more empathetic teacher, especially when working with Hebrew speakers learning English.

I know firsthand how it feels to navigate daily life, job applications, and social situations in a language that's not your mother tongue. This understanding shapes my teaching approach, making it more patient, culturally aware, and tailored to the specific challenges Hebrew speakers face when learning English.

dedication.content: I'm dedicated to helping adults achieve their English goals, whether for career advancement, university studies, travel, or personal growth. Let's work together to build your confidence and skills in a supportive, encouraging environment.

qualifications.title: Qualifications
items: BA in History & Languages, University of Memphis

philosophy.title: Teaching Philosophy
philosophy.content: Every student is unique, with their own goals, learning style, and pace. That's why I don't believe in one-size-fits-all teaching. Instead, I create a completely personalized learning experience for each student, using materials and methods that are relevant to your life and interests. Whether you're preparing for a business presentation, planning a trip abroad, or simply want to feel more confident speaking English, we'll work together to get you there.

intro.title: A Journey Tailored to You
intro.description: Learning a language is a personal journey. My process is designed to be transparent, flexible, and focused entirely on your progress. From our first conversation to achieving your goals, every step is customized to your learning style and needs.

steps.title: Free Consultation (20-30 minutes)
description: Discuss your English goals and needs

steps.title: Level Assessment
description: Identify strengths and areas for improvement
Determine the best approach for you

steps.title: Custom Learning Plan
description: Design a personalized curriculum just for you
Select materials relevant to your interests

steps.title: Begin Learning
description: Weekly virtual lessons (or your preferred frequency)

steps.title: Track Progress & Adapt
description: Adjust the learning plan as needed
Evolve lessons as your skills grow

expectations.title: My Expectations from Students
expectations.intro: Learning a language is a partnership. To get the most from our lessons, I ask that you:
items: Come Prepared - Arrive ready to engage and participate actively
Practice Consistently - Complete exercises and practice between lessons
Be Patient - Progress takes time; trust the process
Communicate Openly - Tell me what's working and what isn't
Use English Daily - Try to practice outside our lessons when possible
expectations.closing: I'm here to guide, support, and challenge you—but your commitment is what makes real progress possible. Together, we'll achieve your English goals.

items.question: How long is each lesson?
items.answer: Standard lessons are 60 minutes, but I also offer 45-minute intensive sessions or 90-minute deep dives depending on your preference and schedule.

items.question: Do I need to buy textbooks?
items.answer: No. I provide all learning materials, including custom worksheets, articles, and digital resources tailored to your specific interests and goals.

items.question: What happens if I need to cancel a lesson?
items.answer: Life happens! You can cancel or reschedule a lesson with at least 24 hours' notice at no charge.

items.question: Do you assign homework?
items.answer: Yes, but it's optional and tailored to your time constraints. Practice between lessons significantly speeds up your progress.
